definition: to compile anew/new (version)/newly set up (part of an organization)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: Chapter Five analyses the creative features of new scenarios of Shanghai"s Peking Opera."
sentences.chinese: 第五章則是對上海京劇新編劇本創作特點的分析。

sentences.english: The performance will include the premiere of three new ballets.
sentences.chinese: 三段新編芭蕾舞將在演出中首演。

sentences.english: The full name of the National Revolutionary Army New Fourth Army.
sentences.chinese: 全稱國民革命軍陸軍新編第四軍。

sentences.english: Chen Danqing collected a full set of Wang Zi's "A New History of Art".
sentences.chinese: 陳丹青收藏了王子全套的《美術新編》。

sentences.english: Content for basic screens must often be paginated to be displayed properly.
sentences.chinese: 基本螢幕內容必須經常重新編頁，才能適當的顯示。

sentences.english: Thanks for sharing. It is a good book.
sentences.chinese: 《新編銑工計算手冊》好資料，謝謝分享。

sentences.english: He has also retold Gulliver's Travels, winner of the Kate Greenaway Medal with Don Quixote.
sentences.chinese: 他還新編格列佛遊記，在格林威獎得主與堂吉訶德。

sentences.english: We enjoyed the concert very much.
sentences.chinese: 這個新編的劇目很好，人人都很欣賞它。

sentences.english: The new play was good and everybody enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 這個新編的劇目很好，大家都很欣賞。
